channel.title: Reconnaissance on SerializingMe
channel.description: Recent content in Reconnaissance on SerializingMe

item.title: Three Honeypots and a Month After
item.description: I deployed three web honeypots, one in Singapore, another in Australia and another one in France. I then leveraged IVRE and Suricata to investigate the visitors, and respective traffic they generated.

item.title: PowaScripts Update: Kerberos Pre-authentication
item.description: After reading harmj0y blog post about “Roasting AS-REPs”, I have decided to update the Dump-User.ps1 script in order for it to report on users that don’t have Kerberos pre-authentication enabled. Running the updated version against a “in the wild” target yielded interesting results to say the least.

item.title: Active Directory Dump
item.description: During many penetration tests (or red versus blue team exercises), I have found myself with the need to investigate users, groups, computers and policies of a Windows domain. To do that, I have developed a series of PowerShell scripts that dump all that information from Active Directory into XML files.
